title: Wednesday boys basketball: MC, Fayette win on opening night | Push | crescent-news.com
text:
STRYKER â€” Miller City raced out to a 24-8 lead after eight minutes, a cushion plenty large enough to hold off host Stryker 55-46 to open the 2025-26 boys basketball season on Wednesday evening.
Four players hit double figures for Miller City (1-0) with Jonny Pester hitting three treys and pouring in 18 points to pace the Wildcats. Henry Rump added a dozen points while Alex Ruck chipped in 11 and Grady Troyer 10.
William Donovan hit eight shots from the field and five from the charity stripe to lead all scorers with 21 points for the Panthers (0-1). Bradley Williams nailed three trifectas and added 17 markers.
MILLER CITY (55) - Ja. Pester 0; Pfau 0; Rump 12; Ruck 11; Jo. Pester 18; Reyna 0; C. Palte 0; Troyer 10; Tobe 4; Long 0. Totals 19-9-55.
STRYKER (46) - Donovan 21; Williams 17; Juillard 0; Capps 0; Rivas 0; An. Batterson 8; Stewart 0; Shindledecker 0. Totals 18-5-46.
Three-point goals: Miller City - Jo. Pester 3, Ruck 2, Troyer 2, Rump. Stryker - Williams 3, An. Batterson 2. Rebounds: Miller City 29, Stryker 19. Turnovers: Miller City 10, Stryker 12.
Miller City;24;4;14;13;-;55
Stryker;8;11;19;8;-;46
- Fayette 59, Hamilton (Ind.) 30: Fayette tallied 59 points in a 59-30 season-opening win over Hamilton (Ind.), a higher scoring output than any of its games last season.
Kruez Lichtenwald nailed four shots from long range and led all scorers with 19 points in the season-opening win for the Eagles (1-0), who broke open a 13-point halftime lead by outscoring the Marines (0-1) 18-5 in the third quarter. Mason Leininger added 11 points and Wyatt Bieber 10.
HAMILTON (30) - Farnham 0; Schieber 4; Lingo 18; Dilts 2; Bean 0; Schick 6; Taylor 0; Willibey 0; Buck 0. Totals 8-9-30.
FAYETTE (59) - Leininger 11; Lichtenwald 19; Ca. Lavinder 8; Oehlers 2; Bieber 10; Andrews 3; Johnston 0; Sperling 2; Schang 2; Dombrowski 2; Cr. Lavinder 0. Totals 24-5-59.
Three-point goals: Hamilton - Lingo 3, Schick 2. Fayette - Lichtenwald 4, Leininger 2. Turnovers: Hamilton 13, Fayette 5.

Fayette;12;16;18;13;-;59
Reserves: Fayette, 46-27.
